N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4209.8 - Recordkeeping, auditing and reporting

State Regulations
(a) Each regional corporation shall maintain
adequate books and records of its activities hereunder and shall submit
semi-annual reports to the corporation describing the financial assistance
provided pursuant to this Part, including: (1)
the number of projects
assisted; (2)
the amount and type
of assistance provided; (3)
a
description of the assisted projects; (4)
the number of jobs created or
retained; (5)
the number of
minority business enterprises and women business enterprises assisted, and the
amount and type of assistance provided same; (6)
the amount of principal and interest in
each working capital loan paid and outstanding; (7)
the amount of each loan guarantee
outstanding; and
(8)
such other
information as the corporation may require. (b) The corporation shall annually audit each
regional corporation to ensure conformity to all aspects of financial
assistance transactions with the substantive and procedural provisions of this

Part. In the event that the corporation finds instances of substantive
noncompliance by a regional corporation with any of the provisions of this

Part, and such instances were, or should have been, known to be in
noncompliance, the regional corporation shall be obligated to return, within a
reasonable time, upon demand by the corporation, any funds advanced by the
corporation for deposit into the regional corporation's loan fund account and
any interest earned thereon. Notes
